turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You know, havin' some fun with it, shit like that.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Where the hell did you learn how to deal?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He bet like a fuckin' brain surgeon.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Place the checks properly. That's the way you do it.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll take Columbia for twenty.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If his girlfriend was knocked up.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, we made a great pair. I made book and Nicky made sure we always collected. The old men loved us. And why not? They all made money with us.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: They payin'?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How did Nicky collect?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It was eight.  Ace... tell him the line on the Bear's game.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Eight.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If he don't know, nobody knows. Told you it was eight.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What's that? You hear? You hear a little girl, Frankie? You hear a little girl, Ace? Is that a little fuckin' girl?!  What happened to the fuckin' tough guy?  Told my friend stick it up his fuckin' ass?! Huh?! Huh?!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Wait a sec, Nicky, Nicky, Nicky. Ta- take it easy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: While I was tryin' to figure out why the guy was sayin' what he was sayin', Nicky just hit him. No matter how big a guy might be, Nicky would take him on. You beat Nicky with fists, he comes back with a bat. You beat him with a knife, he comes back with a gun. And you beat him with a gun, you better kill him, because he'll keep comin' back and back until one of you is dead.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Listen...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But nobody had to take care of Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You find any cash in there, we'll whack it up with you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, he took care of himself only too well. And that's why every badge back home wanted to nail him.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...nobody interfered with the fuckin' skim.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Okay, Sammy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Somethin', huh?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Ginger.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Holy shit, what've you been doin' out here?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Honey, come here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: After we ate, we left Jennifer and Ginger alone and we took a ride to talk. And then... he hit me with it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you think about me movin' out here?  What's the matter? You got a problem with that?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, of course not.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You mean, I have your permission?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Sure, you have my permission. But I - I just gotta tell you it's no joke out here. It's no joke, you know? You gotta keep a low profile. It's not like back home. Right off the bat, they don't like guys like us. And this sheriff's a real cowboy. Even the coppers aren't afraid to bury people out in the desert here.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't care. I want to get away from back home for a while. I'm tired of that shit back there.  Look at this place. It's made of money. You know what the best part is? Nobody's gonna know what we're doin'! There's nobody here to see us! Everybody's back home.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nick, I gotta tell you, I got pinched twice for no reason. You really gotta be careful. I'm running a licensed place. Everything's legit.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't worry about it. I'm not gonna do anything. What am I gonna do? I'm especially not gonna involve you in anything.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But I saw it another. I saw it as untouched. I mean, they had bookies, pimps and drug dealers I could shake down. Who the fuck were they gonna run to?  So, I started getting everybody in line. Best of all, for the first time in my life, I figured out a way not to lose.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, he had a fool-proof scheme, all right. It wasn't very scientific but it worked. When he won, he collected. When he lost, he told the bookies to go fuck themselves. What were they gonna do? Muscle Nicky?  Nicky was the muscle.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Ohh!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And, Nicky being Nicky, he made his presence known.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Especially at the casino, where he definitely did not work, people got the message.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Me? That's why the bosses sent me out here. They wanted me to make sure none of the other crews robbed the joint. Like these two fuckin' balloon-heads over here [EDDY and JERRY]. They were gonna try and bang us out of two hundred fuckin' grand?  Yeah, right, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: When I married Ginger I knew all the stories, but I didn't give a fuck. 'I'm Sam Rothstein,' I said. 'I can change her.'

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It was typical Ace. He invited the biggest people in town and he knew they'd show. Because he knew they all wanted somethin' from him.  With Ace, nobody ever got a free ride. Even Ginger. With her -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...Nicky was dreamin' his own kind of Vegas.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: To begin, I put money out on the streets, chargin' three points a week. You know - juice to the fuckin' dealers.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...the next thing I did, I started bustin' out high-stakes poker players.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It was so obvious. I mean, all of Nicky's half-assed mechanics, they were real signal happy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And I didn't want any of those agents near my place.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Four aces, Doc.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, Nicky's a made guy and I'm not. I can't do that.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Be careful. Gaming agents are all over the place.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So, I'm lucky. I'm not allowed to get lucky in this place?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You been lucky all week. They're lookin' to nail ya.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, I didn't know that. But you know what he did?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: He insulted Billy. And then I walked over to him politely...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...and he tells me to go fuck myself.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Then he called me a faggot.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So what do you think I do? I threw that cocksucker out.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What? Ho-  Hey, come here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: If he does it again, he's out for good. I don't care what it is, Nick, I'm gonna ha- I'll - I'll never let him in the place again.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm sorry about this. Really.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All right, Ace?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Thanks, pal.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But I'll tell you, he knew how to bring in the crowds. He knew all the fuckin' angles. He brought over the whole 'Femme Fatale' show from Paris. But he forgot how lazy them European dancin' broads can get. I mean, he had to weigh 'em in once a week to make sure they didn't blow up like fuckin' balloons.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're still eight pounds over.  What's the reason for this?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, I gotta give the guy credit. He does the most obvious thing. This is the only town in the country where a bookie joint is legit, so, why not take advantage, right?  So... he took bookie joints off the street and then opened them up inside the casino. Well, within a few years, by doin' all of this, he had every casino on the Strip trying to copy off him.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Between...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You better watch yourself. There's a lot of heat on you already.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Why, somebody's complaining?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm - I'm hearin' things from security. They're all ex-cops. The Sheriff's lookin' to bust your balls. They want to put you in the Black Book.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: That Black Book is a bunch of bullshit. They got two names in there for the whole country and one of them is still Al Capone.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Bullshit or no bullshit, they put you in that book, you're gonna be in a lot of trouble. You will not be able to walk into the casino. I'm tellin' you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What am I doin' out here? I'm tryin' to make a livin', that's all.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm just tellin' you. Don't say I didn't warn you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, it wasn't long before what I was afraid was gonna happen, happened. Nicky managed to get himself banned from every casino in Las Vegas, and from then on, I couldn't be seen talkin' to him anywhere in Vegas, or even near it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What the fuck is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ' ...detrimental to gaming. And he will be ejected from any casino in Las Vegas...  and the casinos can be fined as much as a hundred thousand every time he shows up.'  Do you believe this shit?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I believe it. You got banned.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Motherfucker.  Unsavory fuckin'... Is there any way around this?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nope, there's no way.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Let's say... for instance... I want to go in the restaurant which happens to be in the casino... to get one of those sandwiches I like?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Forget it. You can't even set foot in the parking lot. That's how serious it is.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: In other words, I'm fucked.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: In so many words, yes.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It just didn't sink into his head about the Black Book and what it meant. Not being able to go into a casino is just one thing, but being in this book etched your name into the brains of every cop and FBI agent in the state. I mean, you're listed in there with Al Capone. But Nicky didn't care.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I gotta do somethin'. I gotta do somethin'. They ain't gettin' rid of me. They're not gettin' rid of me. I'm staying here. Fuck 'em. Fuck 'em.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, Nicky loved restaurants. He was a real restaurant buff. And over the years, he always made money with them.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, Rich.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: - no matter where he was or what he was doing, he always went home to make breakfast for his son, Nicky- Boy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Here, let's put a little of this on for you. I know you like this. A little butter, right, not a lot?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Listen...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, no it's okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's impossible. It's booked up, and you gotta make a reservation.  It's...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...very difficult to get in.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, it's okay. I'll use the service entrance. I'll see you at nine.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, Ace.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You think he got the point?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What're you doin'? He's a square guy, for chrissakes.  You can't treat him like that. He's gonna run to the FBI.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Fuck the FBI! That prick's been dodging me for three weeks. And what is it with you?  All of a sudden, you're tryin' to tell me what to do all the time.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm not tryin' to tell you what to do. But you were way out of line, Nick. What're you doin'? Where's your head?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Where's my head? Where's your fuckin' balls? Huh? You know I'm tryin' to put somethin' really big together out here. You know what I'm talkin' about, huh? You know!  If you're actin' like this now, how can I depend on you?  There's a lot of things gonna change out here. And if you wanna be there with me, Sammy, you're gonna have to go my fuckin' way.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen, Nick, you gotta understand my situation. I'm responsible for thousands of people. I got a hundred million a year goin' through the place.  It's all over, I'm gonna tell you, it's all over, if I don't get that license.  And believe me, if it goes bad for me, it's gonna go bad for a lot of people, you understand?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, forget about your fuckin' license. I plant my own flag out here, you ain't gonna need a fuckin' license.  You know, I don't know what it is, Sammy, but the more I talk to you, the more I feel like you just don't wanna go along with me, is that it?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, I don't wanna come -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You should say so.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't wanna come along with you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Just say so.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll be honest with you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All right, fine.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't wanna be involved in anything you're talkin' about...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...okay? I just wanna run a square joint. That's it. I just want my license. I want everything nice and quiet. That's it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You mean, quiet like this: 'I'm the boss.'  That's quiet?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That's all taken out of context. Okay.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, that's out of context. Okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I have no control over that. Ronnie and Billy were right there. They'll tell you exactly what happened.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, back home they don't know about fuckin' control. That looks bad.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Looks bad? I'm gonna tell you what looks bad.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Every time you're on television I get mentioned. That looks bad. That looks bad.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What the fuck happened to you? Will you tell me?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What happened to me? What happened to you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You lost your control.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I lost control?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yes, you lost your control.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Look at you. You're fuckin' walkin' around like John Barrymore.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: A fuckin' pink robe and a fuckin'...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...uh, uh, cigarette holder. I'm - I lost control?!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You know, I didn't want to bring this up, but you have treating a lot of people with a lot of disrespect. Even your own wife.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: My wife?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Now, what does she have to do with all this?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, she comes to see me. She was upset about a lot of things, especially that whole fuckin' Diamond - that Lester Diamond incident.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All of a sudden, you're the shoulder to cry on? Did you at least tell her about your little role in that whole situation?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, I didn't. What good would that do? That's not the fuckin' point.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen, I would -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The point is that she's upset. She's - and you got a fuckin' problem.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I - I would appreciate it if you'd stay out of my personal life, okay? You wouldn't like it if I did it to you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, she came to talk...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...to me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...don't do it to me...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: She came to talk to me...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And I - what was I supposed to do, throw her out?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Ju-just stay away from her. It's none of your business, okay? There are certain things you don't do, and you know that.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's none of my business?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That's right, yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: A week ago it was my business, now it's none of my business. In other words, when you need me to take care of somethin' for you, then you need me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, that's right, the way you need me to vouch for you as a citizen and get you out of one of your jams. I'm gonna have to straighten out what you just did with this guy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: This guy is gonna run to the FBI.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Your fuckin' head is getting' bigger than your casino. That's your problem, pal.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I knew what he wanted, and I didn't want any part of it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Fuckin' walking around with a big head. You better check yourself...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nicky wanted to take over. He wanted to go after Gaggi, go after the skim, go after everything and everybody.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nicky was questioned in two dozen murders, but they always had to let him go. There were never any witnesses.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The coppers blamed me for everything that went wrong out here, and I mean every little fuckin' thing too.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Peekaboo, you fucks, you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I see you, you motherfuckers.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The problem was, Nicky was not only bringin' heat on himself, but on me too. The FBI watched every move he made. But he didn't care. He just didn't care.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...on the line and this guy's out havin' the time of his life. He has every cop in the state watchin' him, and he's out playin' golf.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Practice enough this week, you prick?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And at the...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Meet me at three.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What - what, Caesar's?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No, a...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...hundred yards further down the road.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Don't ask questions. Just be there.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Where the fuck you get off talkin' to people about me behind my back? Goin' over my head?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What people?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What people! What'd you think, I wasn't gonna find out?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't even know what you're talkin' about, Nick.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No? You said I'm bringin' heat on you?! I gotta listen to people because of your fuckin' shit?! You're ordering me out?! You better get your own fuckin' army, pal!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I didn't do anything. I mean, I didn't order you or anybody...  I only told Andy Stone that you had a lot of heat on you, and that was a problem.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You want me to get out of my own fuckin' town?!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I said I - let the bullshit blow over for a while so I can run the casino. Anything goes wrong with the casino, it's my ass. It's not yours, it's my ass.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh, I don't know whether you know this or not, but you only have your fuckin' casino because I made that possible!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I'm what counts out here! Not your fuckin' country clubs or your fuckin' TV shows! And what the fuck are you doin' on TV anyhow?!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What are you -

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You know I get calls from back home every fuckin' day?!  They think you went batshit!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm only on TV because I gotta be able to hang around the casino. You understand that. You know that. Come on.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Your fuckin' ass! You could have had the food and beverage job without goin' on television!  You wanted to go on TV.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I did want to go on TV. That way I have a forum. I can fight back. I'm known. People see me. They know they can't fuck around with me like they could if I was an unknown. That's right.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're makin' a big fuckin' spectacle of yourself.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Me?! I wouldn't even be in this situation if it wasn't for you. You brought down so much fuckin' heat on me. I mean, every time I meet somebody here, the big question is do I know you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh, sure. Now you want to blame your fuckin' license on me, is that it?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, it - it - Nicky, when you asked me if you could come out here, what did I tell you? I mean, you asked me, and I knew you were going to come out no matter what I said, but what did I tell you? Do you remember what I told...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Back -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...you? Do you remember what I told you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Back - Back up, back up a fuckin' minute here. One minute. I asked you?! When the fuck did I ever ask you if I could come out here?! Get this through your head, you -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You never - ?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Get this through your head, you Jew motherfucker, you. You only exist out here because of me!  That's the only reason!  Without me, you, personally, every fuckin' wiseguy skell [Skell: the lowest form of wiseguy - a drunken bum] around'll take a piece of your fuckin' Jew ass! Then where you gonna go?!  You're fuckin' warned! Don't ever go over my fuckin' head again! You motherfucker, you!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What are you doin'? You gotta get out of here!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, Sammy, tell this Jew motherfucker over here to pay that marker.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nicky, Nicky, you're not listenin' to me. I'm here to help you. What's the matter with you?  You're gonna bury us both.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Just give me the money. Fuckin' give me the fuckin' money, Sammy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm gonna okay you ten and get you even, and that's it. Then you got to get out of here before the cops and the newspapers are all over you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Ginger called me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I just told you. She called me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And what'd she want?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: She was afraid to call you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, she's with that cocksucker again... and they got Amy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I know. Why didn't you come to me? I mean, this is family, it ain't business. Meanwhile, you make calls back home. Sammy, it makes us look bad out here, you know what I mean? Back and forth, this one and that one, and, in the meantime, she's gone anyway. Am I right?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't know. What am I gonna do with this woman? I don't know...  She's drivin' me fuckin' crazy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I think if you, uh, okay it, you know, assure her that she's gonna be all right, she'll come back.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She's driving me fuckin' crazy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, once you get her here, you think about it, you know?  But get the kid back here. She wants to come back. That's the, uh, that's the main thing here. You want your kid, don't you? Huh?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Sammy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, uh, who's this?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Nick?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, what are you doin'? You okay?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, I'm not okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How'd you know I was here?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...uh, you know, I just wanted to talk to you a minute.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...Ginger's missing and she tied Amy up and she locked her in her room. I gotta find her. I don't know where the hell she is.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah? Well, listen, Ginger's over here at the Leaning Tower with me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She's there with you?  She's there with you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, she's here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Ace don't... listen, don't... don't make a scene, all right?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I want to just talk. I want to talk to that Irish bitch.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: She didn't know who to turn to.  She... she didn't know where to turn. She was tryin' to save your marriage.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah? Nicky, I want to talk to that fuckin' bitch.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, be fuckin' nice. Calm. Be nice. Don't fuck up in here.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Mr Rothstein...  I'm Pat Webb.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How do you do?

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Hey, it is my pleasure.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I heard a lot about you.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Oh, thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Hey, house is doin' well.  Hey, all that money is rollin' in. I appreciate you takin' the time to see a poor ol' civil servant.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, that's quite all right.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Uh, I come here personally to kind of smooth over a fracas about a certain matter. See, uh, maybe you didn't know it, but, uh, Don Ward is a very well-liked man in this town. He's got lots of friends here. Now, his family and their money go back many, many years. Now, friends vote... family and money votes. That's important to me... and you. And if you'll think about our little problem along them lines...  and you forgive me for sayin' it, maybe he did not deserve to be fired.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm sorry, but he knew about our gettin' hit on three big machines in a row and he did nothing about it. That means either he was in on it or, forgive me for saying this, he was too dumb to see what was going on. Either way, I cannot have a man like that workin' here.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Before we point the dirty end of the stick at 'ol Don, uh, we better be sure we can prove them charges.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Believe me, if I could prove it, he would be under arrest.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Are, uh -  - are we certain that you want the Gamin' Control Board eyeballin' your record and your gangster pals like Nicky Santoro?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I think you're way out of line talkin' to me like that. What you're sayin' is libelous, and you're in no position to challenge my expertise. I went way out of my way to be very helpful and courteous to that kid. He's weak, he's incompetent. He jeopardizes the whole place. There's not much more I can do for him.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: You have got me there. Old Don is as useless as tits on a boar.  But, he is my brother-in-law, and I would look on it as a personal favor if you'd think some more on hirin' him back.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I can't do that. And I appreciate the fact that he's your brother-in- law, and I do want to help you and I like to do favors, and I know who you are, but I cannot do that.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Well, could there be any position... further down the trough?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't do anything. He's too incompetent. And the bottom line is, he cannot be trusted.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay, thanks.  Um... you know, that's it. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: Mr Rothstein. Your people never will understand the way it works out here. You're all just our guests. But you act like you're at home. Let me tell you somethin', partner... you ain't home. But that's where we're gonna send you if it harelips the Governor.  Thank you for your time.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No problem.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: WEBB
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Son-of-a-bitch. How the hell did you get Oklahoma-Michigan?  Nobody ever had Oklahoma-Mi... How the hell'd you do it?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, that's why they paid so well.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: You see?  Never tells me nothin'. Ace, what do we got on for next week?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, it's a little too early. I'd say Thursday would be good. I'll know by then. Is that all right?

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Okay. You come by the house?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'll come by.

turns.speaker: GAGGI
turns.text: Seven o'clock?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Seven o'clock.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh, yes. Will you help me fold these, please?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: They were ready to blame him for anything, no matter where it happened.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You go and put your things away.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: And they were usually right.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Because Nicky enjoyed being a gangster, and he didn't give a damn who knew it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Come on. There we go. Look at that. Beautiful.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, that's what worried me, 'cause it turns out Nicky was about to be sent to Vegas.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: All right, we're clear.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: This is Jennifer and Nick. They're dear friends of mine.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Good to meet you.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You know, I don't feel like playin' tennis.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...as soon as Andy got back home, Nicky heard about our talk in the car.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Let's go to lunch. Do you want to go to the Riviera?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Next morning bright and early, I get the call.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello, Jennifer, it's Sam -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Want something to drink? Charlie you want a refill?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Yeah, refill'd be great.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Charlie, you've gotta - you've gotta stop her!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: I-I'm sorry, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You've got to stop her.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: What can I do?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She's a fuckin' junkie. She's out of her fucking mind.  Do you unders-

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Legally, she can't take that stuff. Legally, she can't take the stuff.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: No, Ace.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Half of everything is mine.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE CLARK
turns.text: Ace, listen to me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Half - I'm comin' down.

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: Mr Rothstein, sir, let me put her on suspension.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Never mind the 'sir'. Never mind the 'sir'.

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: Well, sir, I was just...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Why is she eight pounds over?

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: ...trying to offer you the respect that your...

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: ...position...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: 'Mr Rothstein' is good enough.

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: Mr Rothstein... well, sometimes, when you reach that pressure point, when you put that pressure point on them, you know, it shows...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She could at least lose half a pound or a quarter.  Listen...

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: ...and she doesn't always -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...all you do is give me answers. Just - just give me the right answer.

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: But, sir. Well, I don't know why. I guess, maybe, because she's frightened that if she doesn't lose the weight she may even get fired.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That's right. She will get fired. In fact, I want you to send her back to Paris.

turns.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
turns.text: It's always been our policy -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No. Just stop everything.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I hired an old casino pal, Billy Sherbert, as my manager and I went to work.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: ...And this is Ronnie, who takes care of the card room...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: For guys like me, Las Vegas washes away your sins. It's a morality car wash. It does for us what Lourdes does for humpbacks and cripples. And, along with making us legit...

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: We need this guy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: We can't get rid of him?

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: He's juiced in. He's the County Commissioner's cousin.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I wouldn't give the bum a mop job.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I had dozens of politicians and state officials comin' through that place every week.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Nice to see you, Senator.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Help the Senator, give him whatever he wants.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Certainly.  Senator.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Why not make them happy?

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: We have some nice penthouses you'll enjoy. Maybe the Presidential Suite.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Fuckin' asshole won't budge.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Call security.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: This woman's an institution.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't care what she is. She's an institution, that's the problem. She's lazy.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: To Abraham Lincoln.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: L'chaim. [Yiddish for 'to life']

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Here we go. Good luck.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Sam, we got a problem.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: The little guy. He's half in the bag, and nobody told him he was eighty- sixed from the joint, so we...

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Now, he's really pissed.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: He wants a fifty-thousand marker.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, just - just give him, give him ten. That's it. Ten.  I'll be right down.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: He's gonna come up with ten thousand, just the way you wanted.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, Billy Sherbert, please. Put him on.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, Bill, listen, I'll explain to you later. Just - You - You got a gun at home? Yeah. Bring it over here right away.

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: Okay. Just take it easy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Right away. Okay?

turns.speaker: SHERBERT
turns.text: I-I'll do it.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm going to go powder my nose.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Ginger's mission in life was money.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: See you, Ginger.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay, thank you for asking.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She was a queen around the casino. She brought in high rollers and helped them spread around a lot of money.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Any change?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I hit a few... uh, games on the way back.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: That was all bullshit. She just pocketed the cash.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She took care of the dealers...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hey, Mitch.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...pit bosses, floor managers.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But mostly...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...she took care of the valet parkers, the guys who could get you anything and take care of anything.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The Ginger I knew wouldn't even look at this creep.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Within no time, everything was set in place. We got rid of the freelance scamsters. The per was way up.  The gods were happy, or as happy as the gods can ever be.  And I, I decided to complicate my life. For a guy who likes sure things, I was about to bet the rest of my life on a real longshot.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: We're not getting any younger. Don't you think it's time? Aren't you gettin' tired of all this shit? Bangin' around, hustlin' around?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: What, are you trying to handicap me?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm gonna do you one better. I'm trying to marry you. You want to marry me?  I'm serious. I mean, I - I want to settle down. I want a family.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You got the wrong girl, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I know I'd be a good father. I know you'd be a good mother.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You don't know me. What, you've known me, two, three months. What do you know?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm forty-three years old. I don't want to wait. I know you well enough to know that I really love you very much.  And I can't think of anybody better to be with. And I don't feel like waiting anymore.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You know a lot of happily married people, Sam? 'Cause I don't.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I know all that.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I care about you, a - But I just don't have those kind of feelings for you. I'm sorry. I'm not in love with you.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Understand?  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, I - I... mean...  that can grow as I - as long as there's a mutual respect... that kind of thing can grow. I'm realistic. I can accept that. But, you know, what is... What is love anyway?  It's a... it's a mutual respect. It's - it's a devotion. It's a... it's a caring from one person to another. And if we could set up some kind of foundation...  based on that mutual respect...  I feel that eventually you would care enough about me... that I could live with that.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: If it doesn't work out. You know, if it doesn't play out, then what happens to me?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You know I'm doin' well now. And I'm gonna do even better. And so, whatever happens, if it doesn't work out between us, I'm gonna make sure you're okay for the rest of your life. And if there are kids, especially, you know, I'll take care of you better than you'd ever imagine.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: What're you... what're you pitching me, here?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Just what I said. You'll be set up for the rest of your life. That I can promise you.  Want to take a chance?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Why're you crying?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm not crying.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Maybe you shouldn't drink so much.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm okay. I just -  You just have to understand. I've been with Lester since I was a kid. I just wanted to say goodbye. I - I just...  I don't... I think I have a right to do that. Okay?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's all right. That part of your life is over with. Right?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're with me now.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Right?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Want to go? Let's go back in.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You're kidding? My God. What is it?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's chinchilla.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, it's so soft.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's nice isn't it?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: So, do you think it's too much if I wear these in the same day?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You do whatever you want. Do I keep my promises, or do I keep my promises?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You're so wonderful. The jewelry's not so bad, either.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The only thing is... you shouldn't keep this in the house. We gotta put it in a bank.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Come on. Can I keep this one in the house?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Now look,  pay attention to me. What I'm gonna tell you is very important.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All this stuff doesn't mean anything. Money, this, doesn't mean anything without trust. I have to be able to trust you with my life.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Crooked cops and kidnappers, they don't take checks.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Need a little help with that, Mr Collins?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So, I put two million in cash in a Los Angeles bank under the name of Mr and Mrs Tom Collins. This was strictly my shakedown and kidnapping money.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hi. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She could be the most charming woman you ever saw. People loved to be around her.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Hey, do you want to see this one? Daddy gave me all this jewelry because he loves me so much.  Put your arm in there.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But as much as they loved her...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, fabulous.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...they didn't know what really moved her.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay, want to go with Mommy?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What do you need?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You get her?  Okay.  Well, I need a lot. I need more than usual.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, why don't you take it out of your account? There's a lot there.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Well, I would, you know, Sam. It's just that... well, I need more than that. I need twenty-five thousand.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Twenty-five thousand? For yourself?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Why do you need that much?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Well, what's the difference? I just need it.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, I mean... you know, I gotta ask you. That's a lot of money. You're not asking for a box of popcorn, you know. I mean...

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I'm aware of that. We don't have to turn this into a big deal.  Okay? We don't have to have a fight. It was important to me. But forget it. Just something I wanted to do for myself.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Who's fighting? I mean, I'm, you know, tell me what it's for.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Huh?  Well, you know what? Now, I want you to tell me. I mean, my wife comes to me and asks me for twenty-five thousand. I mean, what do you want? Do you want a coat?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well, if you want a coat, you got it. You know that. It's not the money, it's just why do you want it?  That's all I'm askin'. Am I not entitled to that?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Look - Sam, I've been independent my whole life. I never had to ask anybody for anything. Now you're making me beg you for this.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What are you talkin' a- ?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay? And you're embarrassing me. Why do want to make me feel so bad?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You're askin' me for twenty-five thousand. I'm not out to make you feel bad. I want to just be able to trust you. You now, it's about trust. I have to be able to trust you with my life. Do you understand? Can I trust you?  Can I trust you?... Can I trust you?... Answer me. Can I trust you?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You can trust me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Good, so then you could tell me what the money is for.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You remember when you called him that night? When you said goodbye to him?  He didn't say, 'Don't get married, I'll be right down, we'll get married.'  He didn't say that to you, did he?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: No, he didn't.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Didn't. No, instead, what did he say? 'Fuck him. Take him for everything he's got.'

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Isn't it bad enough you're drinkin' too much, you're takin' all my pills too?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I didn't take your pills.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Look - for my ulcer, I take a half a one of these, a half a one of these. And that's when I have extreme pain. I had a three-month supply. What'd you do with 'em?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You didn't have to beat him up!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I was just tryin' to help him. It's not like I'm sleeping with the guy!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, how do I know?

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You can't make me stop caring...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What? What?!

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I said, you can't make me stop caring about people.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Listen.  Ginger. I'm tryin' to make the best of everything here, you know?  I mean, you're my wife, for chrissakes. Uh, I mean... people look up to you in this town. I don't know what to think -

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: You know what, Ace? I don't give a shit! I'm gettin' out of here.  I am.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's okay.  Look...  ...you gotta get a hold of yourself.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: If not for me, at least for Amy.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You understand? Your drinking's gettin' way out of hand. I'm gonna get you into a program. They got plenty of good ones.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: I don't need one.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yes, you do. It's very discreet. There's no names in the papers. You don't have to worry about any of that stuff.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: That's all you care about.  You don't care about me at all.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yes, I - yes, I do.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: No, you don't.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: How could you say that?  You're a beautiful woman. You're destroying yourself. You don't need that stuff. You don't need that fuckin' leech livin' off you. I know you better than you know yourself. You're a tiger, you're stronger than I am. And when you set your mind on doing something, you do it better than anybody.  You can do it.  You can do it.

turns.speaker: GINGER
turns.text: Oh, God. Oh, God. Okay.  Okay... I'll try. I'll try.
